title: Systematic Lattice QCD and Heavy-Ion Predictions

checks.name: Positive String Tension
checks.description: σ must be positive (confinement energy)
checks.details: String tension is positive

checks.name: Positive T_c
checks.description: Deconfinement temperature must be positive
checks.details: T_c is positive

checks.name: Real Constituent Masses
checks.description: Constituent quark masses must be real and positive
checks.details: Constituent masses are real and positive

checks.name: Finite Correlation Length
checks.description: Correlation length must be finite (causality)
checks.details: Correlation length is finite, causality preserved

checks.name: Perturbative Unitarity
checks.description: Coupling g_χ should satisfy perturbative bounds
checks.details: Coupling within perturbative regime

checks.name: High-T Deconfinement
checks.description: At T >> T_c, deconfinement must emerge
checks.details: CG consistent: Debye screening (m_D ~ gT) dominates at high T

checks.name: Low-T Confinement
checks.description: At T << T_c, confinement must be recovered
checks.expected: σ(T << T_c) → σ(0), Wilson loop area law
checks.details: CG consistent: String tension saturates at T << T_c

checks.name: Large-r Area Law
checks.description: Wilson loop should show area law at large r
checks.details: Area law correctly predicted from flux tube picture

checks.name: Small-r Coulomb Behavior
checks.description: Should recover Coulomb-like V(r) ~ -α/r at small r
checks.details: CG flux tube model recovers Coulomb at short distances via asymptotic freedom

checks.name: SU(3) Casimir Scaling
checks.description: String tension ratios must follow Casimir scaling
checks.details: SU(3) gauge symmetry preserved

checks.name: Z_3 Center Symmetry
checks.description: Z_3 center symmetry should break at T_c
checks.expected: <L> → 0 for T < T_c, <L> → 1 for T > T_c
checks.computed: CG: Thermal fluctuations overcome stella geometry at T_c ~ √σ/π
checks.details: Z_3 center symmetry behavior consistent with crossover

checks.name: Chiral Symmetry Restoration
checks.description: Chiral symmetry should be restored near T_c
checks.computed: CG: Chiral crossover coincides with deconfinement at T_c ~ 156 MeV
checks.details: Chiral restoration consistent with lattice QCD crossover picture

checks.name: String Tension √σ
checks.description: Compare √σ with lattice QCD
checks.details: Deviation: 0.05σ - Excellent agreement

checks.name: Deconfinement Temperature T_c
checks.description: Compare T_c with lattice QCD
checks.details: Deviation: 1.52σ - Good agreement

checks.name: Critical Ratio T_c/√σ
checks.description: Universal dimensionless ratio
checks.details: Deviation: 0.63σ - This ratio tests the underlying physics

checks.name: Flux Tube Width
checks.description: Transverse size of QCD flux tube
checks.details: CG predicts ~28% larger than lattice central value

checks.name: R_stella Framework Origin
checks.description: R_stella should derive from Definition 0.1.1
checks.details: R_stella is the characteristic scale from stella octangula boundary

checks.name: Definition 0.1.1 Consistency
checks.description: Euler characteristic from stella octangula
checks.details: Euler characteristic correctly derived from Definition 0.1.1

checks.name: Proposition 3.1.1c Consistency
checks.description: g_χ should match geometric coupling formula
checks.computed: With RG to Λ_QCD: g_χ ~ 1.3 (claimed in 8.5.1)
checks.details: RG running factor ~2.9 from UV to Λ_QCD needs verification

checks.name: PDG 2024 Consistency
checks.description: Framework should not contradict PDG values
checks.expected: No contradictions with established QCD parameters
checks.computed: All CG predictions consistent with PDG/FLAG bounds
checks.details: CG uses √σ = 440 MeV as input, consistent with FLAG 2024

checks.name: Heavy-Ion HBT Compatibility
checks.description: CG coherence length vs HBT radii
checks.expected: Macroscopic: R ~ 5-7 fm; CG predicts ξ ~ 0.45 fm
checks.computed: ξ_CG = 0.448 fm << R_HBT, consistent with two-component picture
checks.details: CG predicts short-range component not captured by standard Gaussian HBT

checks.name: Novel: QGP Coherence Length
checks.description: NOVEL prediction: ξ_eff = R_stella = 0.448 fm
checks.details: Testable at ALICE/STAR: compare HBT at different beam energies

checks.name: Novel: HBT Two-Component
checks.description: NOVEL prediction: Two-component HBT correlation
checks.expected: Additional Gaussian at ξ ~ 0.45 fm, ~7% amplitude
checks.details: Challenging but potentially measurable with high statistics
